metadata.title: CVE-2020-6808 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
When a JavaScript URL (javascript:) is evaluated and the result is astring, this string is parsed to create an HTML document, which is thenpresented. Previously, this document's URL (as reported by thedocument.location property, for example) was the originating javascript:URL which could lead to spoofing attacks; it is now correctly the URL ofthe originating document. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 74.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6808` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
